alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 7:54PM EDT until July 11 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Flooding has been reported near the Cold River in South Acworth. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Even though rainfall rates have decreased. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 PM EDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont, Charlestown, Marlow, Newport, Alstead, Stoddard, Walpole, Lempster, Acworth and Goshen.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
